If she could give the good doctor any sort of credit, he was certainly consistent with his theming. From where she stood, the ground sloped downward before hitting a large plot of ground that had been made unnaturally flat. Steel walkways and conveyer belts jutted out at sharp angles from a large, round building that was very clearly modeled to look like Robotnik's face. Peppered around the perimeter were a number of thin metallic spires, tesla coils at the top. Blaze found herself tempted to personally track down the Doctor and smack him once she realized that these spires were clearly designed to resemble egg cups.

The place was clearly abandoned. Rust had begun to seep in from seams and crevasses in the metal plating where erosion and time allowed for rain to pool within. Stray Egg-Pawns scattered about the area stood frozen in place where they had once idly patrolled before running out of fuel, paint chipped off in random sporadic patterns. As Blaze strolled forward, she heard no sirens, no alarms, just the ambience noise of the jungle and her heels clacking against the steel floor.

There was something unsettling about this place. While it was true that Eggman rarely cleaned up after himself, leaving bases empty and robot viscera for someone else to deal with, the bases he left behind were often gutted, if not by raiders then by the man himself not wanting to give up all of his stuff. Leaving behind badniks that presumably were functioning just fine simply seemed wasteful.

And beyond this was the way the jungle itself seemed repelled by the structure. While bits of grass and roots seeped into the edges of the ground, there seemed to be no real attempt for nature to reclaim the area. No flowers growing up through cracks in the metal, no signs of animal life nesting within, no signs of life whatsoever.

As Blaze drew closer to the main building, she began to sense some sort of energy from within. It felt like nothing of this world, nor of her own world. It felt strange and dark. And Blaze found herself drawn to it.

Without thinking, she enters the base, following this energy to its source. What is causing this strange power?
